intro: Piper erectipilum, commonly known as the upright-hair pepper, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, containing numerous tiny seeds. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and potential medicinal research.
